entry.title: Re: Distribution Channel set-up cause issue in DRF Replic...

In DRFIMG, you can define a new Custom Filter Object, maintain filter values and implement a custom ABAP filter to override the standard filter outcome and inject the desired SalesArrangement nodes. This pattern is documented step-by-step in the below blogs, for DRF custom filters and segment filters for BP 986/986_3, including how to assign the filter object in DRFIMG and control it via DRFF

DRF Custom ABAP BAdI Filter Implementation

Best Regards,

Nithin

entry.title: Re: You are not authorized to query the remote system. Pl...
entry.content:
This message means your user account doesn’t have the necessary permissions to access the remote system — specifically, you’re missing the InA (Information Access) role.

To resolve this:

  1. Contact your system administrator or whoever manages roles/permissions in your organization.

  2. Ask them to assign you the InA role on the remote system you're trying to query.

  3. Once the role is granted, you should be able to access the data without issues.

If you're unsure who the admin is, check with your IT team or platform owner — they’ll usually know who can manage user roles.

entry.title: Propose same requestor in multiple line items automatically in a purchase request
entry.content:
When creating new purchase request, is it possible for system to capture the requestor of one line item and propose same requestor in other line items automatically in a purchase request? 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Propose same requestor in multiple line items automat...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

The only possible standard way to achieve this: when creating new purchase request, firstly create one line item, maintain the requestor for this line item, then select button Copy to create new line item, the requestor in original line item will be brought into the new line item.

Henry

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAC Previous Year(Measure) by dynamic filter
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes it is doable with a restricted measure.

Step 1: Create a restricted measure, let's say current month and then add the standard measure and the period.

Step2: Then create another restricted measure and add the newly created restricted measure in step 2 [Prev year Month] and set the period to previous Month/Period.

and lastly create a new calculated measure say [prev year Month] based on static input control write a IF condition.

Thanks,

Vinay

entry.title: Re: Standard outbound idoc don't send specific fields
entry.content:
Unfortunately, there is no direct configuration or transaction code that allows you to selectively exclude or blank out fields in a standard outbound IDoc without coding, user exits, or modifying the IDoc type.

SAP always fills the fields based on the standard function module logic like IDOC_OUTPUT_INVOIC. To suppress fields, you would need a custom function module assigned in WE20, Or a user exit / enhancement like EXIT_SAPLVV01_001 for INVOIC.

entry.title: Re: MRP not considering batch length Correctly
entry.content:
Hi,

I would suggest instead of maintaining base UOM as meters, maintain it as EA or PC and maintain UOM conversion as equal to 1. EA/PC = 4M. So when MRP plans this material it will in EA or PC which will always be equivalent to 4 m.

let me know if this answers your query.

Regards,

Ninad

entry.title: Re: ABAP Cloud Developer Trial 2023 Available Now
entry.content:
Good morning Mauricio!

You are right. SAP cloud Trial on Docker is for free.

On SAP Cloud Appliance Library (CAL) it uses the infrastructure of AWS/Azure/Google and therefore you need to pay.

At CAL in addition you get a preconfigured frontend so you don't need to run sap logon/eclipse  at your local device. If the costs overweigt the benefit, is your decision. Take care to shutdown an instance if it's not used. The monthly cost for a permanently running one is about 4 digits. (Dollar)

 

Hope this helps

Regards Ralf

entry.title: Re: Self Service Procure cookbook doesn't describe how th...
entry.content:
Hello @Robson1 

Thanks for your update. To clarify, in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you cannot use PA30, PA40, or PPOMA. These transactions are exclusive to on-premises HR and Organisational Management.

For Public Cloud, please verify the following carefully

Assign the catalogue to the user
Use the app Default Settings for Users – Purchase Requisitions to set the user’s Default Procurement → Catalogue.
SAP Help Portal – Default Settings for Users

Load and index catalogue items
Run the job Schedule Import of Catalogue Data so that items are indexed and visible in Cross-Catalogue Search.
 SAP Help Portal – Schedule Import of Catalogue Data

Authorisation
Ensure the user has access to My Purchase Requisitions – New (F1639A) through a role such as Employee Procurement.

Troubleshooting
If items still don’t appear, check SAP KBA 2680363 Internal catalogue items cannot be found in Cross-Catalogue Search.” Sometimes, rerunning the import job fixes the issue.

No PA30 or PPOMA is needed; all is handled via Cloud apps and catalogue indexing.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Blocked Sales Order
Re: GLT2201 - Balancing field "Business Area" in line ite...
entry.content:
It seems, Document splitting is activated in your system where Business Area is defined as a mandatory splitting characteristic. During MIGO, the system tries to create accounting entries but cannot determine the Business Area for one or more lines. The account assignment which is nothing but cost center or internal order is missing or incomplete and the plant-to-business area mapping is not maintained.

When performing MIGO, what Account Assignment is flowing ? If you are using a cost center, make sure it has a valid Business Area. If not, consider assigning one or using a substitution rule.

Go to OBBH, create a rule to derive Business Area based on plant, cost center, or other logic.

Finally, check whether you need to carry out code corrections as recommended in SAP note 2574432

entry.title: Re: FI: Opening balance change
entry.content:
Hi @nithin_pranesh 

Yes, you can adjust your inventory and asset balances as of 31st Dec 2024 but be sure to carefully follow SAP’s standard procedures for corrections after operational entries have already been posted into 2025.

  • In doing this please note that opening balances should match audited figures and corrections are frequently required after audit.
  • Since you have proceeded with depreciation and postings for 2025, you cannot directly overwrite the previously uploaded balances. You must adjust them by using special postings for the prior period.

I have listed below ways you can carry out the changes and what you should take note of in doing it. 

  1. To carry out the adjustments, post Value Adjustments for Opening Balances through manual subsequent postings by using the Fiori App Carry Forward Balances for Ledger Groups. This process creates adjustment entries posted to period 0 or a special adjustment period in December to correct opening balances without interfering with your current year’s operations.
  2. Ensure to make use of the special adjustment periods for corrections after the fiscal year is closed but before annual closing make use of an adjustment period. This will ensure your corrections are posted as adjusting journal entries dated 31.12.2024, with necessary documentation marking them as audit adjustments. This ensure your changes flow into 2025 and are reflected in your reporting correclt.
  3. For your assets, make use of the Adjustment to Asset Block Opening WDV or Transactions app to adjust the opening Written Down Value (WDV) or acquisition values as of the opening date. Enter all relevant details.
  4. For your inventory, ensure to post an adjustment as of 31st Dec 2024, thereby you mark the entry as an opening balance correction. Ensure this is aligned with your reconciliation and that inventory G/Ls are properly impacted.

Please note, all your subsequent postings, whether depreciation, stock movement, etc. for 2025 will remain valid. Adjustment entries will only affect values as of Dec 31, 2024. Ensure you document for audit reasons. It is important to coordinate these with your finance team and SAP support.

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Post Value Adjustments for Opening Balances

Adjustment after year end closing

Adjust Book Inventory

entry.title: Re: Hello experts , i want to configure "Block" phase con...

entry.title: Completing the B2B migration into SAP Integration Suite vision
entry.content:
The last part to be migrated is the B2B integrations you have like EDIFACT, X12 or what formats you are using. The official guidance is to use MIG and MAGs to handle the migration.

It is not really ideal because it will require a large investment in recreation of all your partner mappings. There can be cases where it make sense and a good way to streamline your B2B setup. Many of your partner mappings have probably not been touched for years.

SAP has also published a version of a way to handle the migrations. That will allow you to reuse the mappings. Do give it a try to see how it will work for you.

I published something about our vision for the migration 2 years ago about how I saw that you could migrate to it.

We have now completed this journey about making it possible to perform the migration in an end to end flow. I would say it is much more complete than I had expected. It now feels like a smooth process with tooling that supports you all the way.

We wanted to create a tool that extended the standard usage of SAP TPM, but removed some of the biggest challenges that exists when working with it.

Can the migration work

We and one of our partners have been able to work with the initial version of the migration. It has been possible to retrain the message mapping and perform small changes in the used Java, UDF, XSLT to make it work.

We created a simple iflow with Process Direct and then the mappings that had been migrated with Figaf. We also added a XML formatter that translated between SAP PI B2B format and the MIG format.

Our customer said that the message mappings were not causing any problems.

But the strategy work and you can run your migration this way.

End to end Flow

Here is an example of how this works end-to-end and shows you that the migration is possible.

 Steps in the migration

 Test data recording from SAP PI

Before you can migrate your integration, you must have some test cases. Here we can record messages from SAP PI and filter one the content to find the message for the correct partners. This is something we have had for a long time.

Partner creation

We have added a streamlined way to create partners. Currently you need to fill in a lot of different values and if you will need to create a partner.

Then you get partners created in a standard and consisted way with identifies and connected system. This will make the transport process easier.

There are still going to be some manual changes that you will need to fill for the adapters but this should simplify your operation.

Migration overview

We have built a specific overview of how your migration is going. This is going to make it easier to see what you have migrated and what still is missing. You can see what is migrated to what agreements.

 

Operation mapping migration

We have decided to migrate from Operation Mapping and then convert it to Process Direct flow. Here you can use Figaf functions for converting UDF to groovy, or use the Cloud Integration Function Libraries. We recommend that you migrate the TPM lookup to Groovy because then you can easy get to find and replace the functions that you need.

To create the agreement you need to select

  • Self

  • Partner

  • Agreement template (yes you need to create them with MAGs, to easily find MIGs used)

  • Then you from the dropdown can fill in the information used in the Agreement

Once everything is filled in correctly you just click migrate which will create all the objects needed.

We do support the use of generic mappings, if you want to use the target iflows consistently.  

 Testing

Once you have deployed the flow and the agreement, you can migrate the test. Then the test case can run on the TPM flows.

Then you will need to perform the corrections to ensure it produces the correct result.

The cool part about this is that you can keep the test cases and use them when something change either to the Integration Suite, or you need to change something else as a part of the maintenance of your partners.

Road map

We are currently working on a way that allows you to transport the Agreements as we do for all the other objects. This will make it much easier to have one way to manage all integrations.

Learn more

You can explore this with our free migration edition, which will allow you to migrate 10 Operations mappings and test them.

There are several prerequisite steps that you need to follow to create a solid foundation. You can see the steps here. You can see this guide.

entry.title: Re: RM07DOCS dumped with TSV_TNEW_PAGE_ALLOC_FAILED
entry.content:
You need to convince your BA and educate him/her that MB51 is a powerful report, but it’s designed to work best when we help it narrow down the data. When we run it with only plant as a filter, it tries to pull millions of records, which is why it crashes or runs out of memory. By adding filters like Posting Date or Movement Type, we’re not limiting your access — we’re making sure you get the data faster, more reliably, and without system errors.

Still if you are not able to convince, then, you can create a screen variant for mb51 via shd0 with pre-filled values like plant, posting date. Assign it to a user or role. This lets your Business Analyst run MB51 with default filters, even if they don’t manually enter them.

The other option is to create ZMB51 which should be copy of RM07DOCS Program, where you can add standard variant via se38 or se80 where you can include default filters like Posting Date, Movement Type, etc. This gives full control and avoids dumps — especially useful if MB51 is used frequently with minimal filters.

But again, the current practice is strictly not recommended and if needed, you need to take it up to next level

entry.title: Webinar: як хмарна ERP та AI забезпечують точність бізнес рішень.
entry.content:
Real-time дані для CFO!

Фінансовий директор сьогодні - це не лише про контроль цифр. Це про швидкість ухвалення рішень, здатність передбачати ризики та вчасно бачити нові можливості для бізнесу.

Але як зберігати цю швидкість, якщо ринок змінюється щодня? Відповідь - у сучасних інструментах, які допомагають:

👌знімати з вас рутину;
👌забезпечувати єдину картину бізнесу в реальному часі;
👌скорочувати витрати та одночасно відкривати шлях до зростання.

Саме про це говоритимемо на практичному вебінарі. Ви дізнаєтесь:

✅Як просто та ефективно керувати компанією за допомогою хмарних рішень.
✅Як вбудований ШІ автоматизує рутину та допомагає швидше ухвалювати обґрунтовані рішення.
✅Як ми скоротили час закриття місяця з 10 до 4 днів і зменшили витрати на інфраструктуру на 70 % завдяки хмарній ERP.

📌Приєднуйтеся 23 вересня о 16:00!

📲Реєструйтеся тут: https://lnkd.in/dRuKa_da

entry.title: Re: Rebate and Royalties in SAP S/4
entry.content:
Hi @sumit_chourasia1 ,

SAP Condition Contract Settlement does not create SD Billing Documents: "Settlement in Condition Contract Management is posted through a Settlement Document directly to FI, so posting through an SD invoice is no longer possible". See 2815535 - FAQ: Condition Contract Management by Settlement Management in SAP S/4HANA - SAP for Me.

It is possible to use multiple data sources for the business volume. For this you have to configure "Additional Business Volume Tables" within the "Profiles for Business Volume Determination". An example for a table that is reading settlement documents is  C_SETLDOCITMSCOMMSNBIZVOL. You find this example in the document CCM_External_Sales_Commissions_Standard_Configuration_2023.pdf. See 2535889 - CCM - Description of delivered configuration - SAP for Me.

Helpful reading: Settlement Management | SAP Community

entry.title: Re: Error while uploading PDF file in "Create supplier in...
entry.content:
Hello @Varun_Arora1 

Thank you for your question.

The error on your attached screenshot is a known issue in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and Fiori apps. This error typically results from either the file not being properly selected, a problem with your Content Version attachment services or a missing parameter in document management configuration.

  • Ensure the PDF file is valid, not empty and correctly selected before clicking upload. You can reselect and again.
  • Consider clearing your browser cache and try a different browser or incognito window.
  • Make sure your SAP DMS is configured and enabled in your environment, as attachments in Fiori rely on corresponding content management settings.

Sometimes, it has happened that backend permissions or temporary system blocks especially after you have carried out migration activities can prevent generating a valid file ID for attachment.

You can open an incident with SAP if the error persists.

The SAP KBA on attachment upload errors provides further details.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Keeping Positions in Sync with Job Info Portlet in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
entry.content:
Agenda

  1. Why Job Info → Position sunchornization matters
  2. Step-by-step configuration with Business Rules
  3. Role of Event Reasons
  4. Best practices to avoid errors
  5. Final thoughts

Why positions and job info must match in Successfactors Employee Central?

Position and Job Info Both should Match. Usually positions have tendency to sync data to job info. That means if you get 1 new update in position then those information can be automatically populated from Position Job Info Via position to Job Info Synchronization.

Why Job Info and Position must match in Successfactors Employee Central?

  • If you have different information on employee profile and on a position, how can you recognize the correct information?
  • So, You need to sync both to avoid mismatch info. If you are not using sync then you're losing automation as the data from the position.
  • In configuration using position management, only use Position-to-Job Info synchronization direction. I strongly recommend you to use Position to Job info Sync in Manage Position management settings to reduce the User error.

How Synchronization works:

  • Go to "Position Management Settings".
  • Navigate to the "Synchronization Tab".
    • The "Synchronization Tab" determines the behavior of the system when synchronizing data from a Position to an employee’s Job Information. This includes the rules for defining fields used in synchronization of Position to an employee’s Job Information.
  • Configure the fields that should sync
  • Add Business Rules for triggering updates (e.g., when a position is changed, reflect changes in Job Info).

Step-by-Step: Position to JobInfo Sync Configuration with Business Rule:

Define the Use Case:

  • When a change happens in the Job Information Portlet  (like Department, Division, Location), it should automatically reflect in the Position Object.
  • This is handled via a Business Rule using the Scenario: Synchronize Incumbent’s Changes to Position Scenario.

Step: 1 - Create the Business Rule:

  1. Go to Configure Business Rules.

  2. Click Create New Rule.

  3. Choose Position Management  - Pre Delivered Template. 

  4. Under Scenario, select: Synchronize Incumbent’s Changes to Position Scenario.

Step 2 - Register the Rule in Position Management Settings:

  1. Go to Admin Center → Position Management Settings.

  2. Navigate to the Synchronization Tab.

  3. Find the field: "Rule for Synchronizing Job Information to Position".

  4. Assign the Business Rule you just created (JobToPos)

  5. Save the configuration.

Step: 3 Event Reason object configuration

  • Event Reasons act as triggers for synchronization.
  • Common examples:
    • Position Transfer → when an employee moves to a new role.
      • If you are going to change the position then position transfer will be use as follow up activity.
    • Position Reclassification → when department/division updates occur.
      • If you want to change in department and Division then Position Reclassification will be use as follow up activity.
  • These objects ensure accurate, event-driven updates.
  • For the Job info to position Synchronization we need to get help from event reason. On the base of event reason we will get change. Mainly we creates three objects event reason to change happen from Job info to position.

Step: 4 job information portlet and create Business Rule

Prerequisite:

  • First you need to go to Job Information Portlet and check here if we have Event and Event Reason Picklist field is enabled or not.
  • If its enabled and will be visible there then we don’t need to write the business rule for this case user will select manually.
  • If its not enabled then event and event reason will not come up here so we have write the business rule.

Regards,

Mahnoor Naseem

SAP SuccessFactors Consultant

If you found this blog a useful please consider giving it a Kudos

entry.title: Re: Error creating number group range for range object: E...
entry.content:
Hola @MatiasGarciaKPS 

Thanks for your message. In SAP S/4HANA, Public Cloud, the number range object for eDocument Spain – Verifactu (EDOC_ESVF) is delivered as SAP-controlled. This is why the fields appear read-only and why the Copy Subobject option leads to an authorisation error; the system does not allow customers to create or extend ranges for this object.

If you need separate number ranges for multiple companies, the recommended path is to open an SAP Incident under component CA-GTF-CSC-EDO (eDocument Compliance). SAP Support can then confirm whether an enhancement or additional SSCUI option is available for your release.

Check below SAP help references:

SAP Help Portal – Spain: Electronic Invoicing with Verifactu

3609812 - FAQ - Electronic Document Processing for Spain VERI*FACTU legal change 2025/2026

SAP Help-Using Evaluated Invoice Settlement

In summary, the observed behaviour is deliberate in Public Cloud, and new ranges for EDOC_ESVF cannot be created directly.

Feel free to reach out when ever you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Building an Attachment Upload and Download Solution Using UploadSetwithTable Control
entry.content:
Hi @tejaswikosanam as I mentioned above, your scenario should be achievable.

When you click upload, you have to create the binding without sending the patch request, which should update the table locally on the UI. Later, when you press the save, you can send your local changes to the backend.

Give it a try in this direction.

An answer to your question in the community:  You can skip the default uploader and use your implementation the same way I am using it in this blog post. All you have to do is put the uploader under the aggregation uploader.

<uploader>
<upload.UploaderTableItem httpRequestMethod="Put"/>
</uploader>

entry.title: Your First Step to Success: Cloud Onboarding for SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
This concise course, lasting no more than four hours, is the essential first step in understanding SAP and beginning your implementation journey. Whether you’re a customer or a partner, it provides a detailed look into SAP's onboarding process, covering everything from system access and S-User management to leveraging SAP's extensive support network.

👉 The course follows the key phases of onboarding:

  • Get Started
  • Plan Your Implementation
  • Get Enabled
  • Prepare to Go-Live

Each step ensures you’re set up for success and ready to realize value quickly.

What You’ll Gain

By the end of this course, you’ll know how to:

  • Plan projects effectively using SAP Activate and SAP Cloud ALM
  • Accelerate implementation with SAP Best Practices
  • Manage upgrade cycles with confidence
  • Leverage innovative tools and AI to unlock new business potential

Why It Matters

This course is more than just onboarding—it’s about giving you the foundation, tools, and confidence to maximize your SAP Digital Manufacturing investment and drive continuous success.

Take the Next Step

Don’t miss this opportunity to set your journey up for success. Enroll in Cloud Onboarding for SAP Digital Manufacturing and build a strong foundation for your business.

#SAPLearning #CustomerSuccess #OnboardingJourney #SAPCustomerOnboarding #DigitalTransformation #GetStarted #SAPDigitalManufacturing

entry.title: SAP RAP ListReport - ValueHelp not displayed in parameted dialog for action
entry.content:
Hello Everybody,

In SAP RAP (S4Hana on premise 2022) I have defined an Action with parameter:

static action notPlanedRev parameter ZD_BEFR_FUNC_LOC result [1] $self;

Hier is the defiinition of Entity:

@EndUserText.label: 'Parameter für Aktion notPlanedRev'
define root abstract entity zd_befr_func_loc

{
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: 'ZC_BEFR_FUNC_LOC', element: 'FuncnlLocPrimaryLabelName'  }}]
  FunctionalLocation : text40;
  RevTxt             : text40;
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: 'I_PlantStdVH', element: 'Plant'  }}]
  Plant              : werks_d;
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: 'zc_befr_work_center_vh', element: 'WorkCenter'  },
                                      additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'Plant', element: 'Plant', usage: #FILTER_AND_RESULT }]}]
  WorkCenter         : arbpl;
  duration           : int2;
}

I have exposed the Entities for SH in mein Service (Binding OData V2 - UI)

@EndUserText.label: 'PM GBR Betriebsfreigabe'
define service Zui_pm_gbr_befr {
  expose zc_befr_revision;
  expose zc_befr_func_loc;
  expose ZC_BEFR_NOTIF_ASSIGNED;
  expose ZC_BEFR_NOTIF_ASSIGNED_RELEASE;

}

How can it be solved?

Regards,

Boguslaw

entry.title: SAP Community Team Spotlight: Josh Bentley - September 2025 Edition
entry.content:
You probably have already seen the past interviews of this series (one / two / three / four / five / six / seven / eight ) which were done by my colleague Marco Santos. Today I am very excited to introduce you to another amazing person behind the SAP Community platform. Here we are with another SAP Community Spotlight, @josh_bentley ! 

 

Fatemeh Zarei (FZ): Hi Josh! Thank you so much for joining us today. To kick things off - would you like to tell us a little bit about your iconic blue beard? How did that all start?

Josh Bentley: So, every superhero has their own origin story - mine's just a little less dramatic. I’ve been talking about technology for nearly 25 years, and in 2018, I joined the Developer Advocates team after leaving the Cloud Center of Excellence. At a conference - SAP TechEd - the women on our team had all these vibrant hair colors and teased us guys for being boring. I thought, “Why is it only the women showing personality?” But I don’t have hair - I’m bald! So, one of them said, “Well, you can dye your beard.” I didn’t take it seriously at first, but before SAP TechEd in 2019, I thought, "Why not?" I texted her for tips, used paper towels to mix colors until I got close to SAP blue, and I’ve kept it ever since. This October marks six years! What keeps me doing it is not just for my ego boost but for the smiles I get from others and the joy they truly show me when they see me.

FZ: That’s fantastic! Now, shifting gears a bit - how did you first get involved with the SAP Community?

Josh: That goes back to my pre-sales days, around 2011 or 2012, when we had the “Blog It Forward” campaign that Moshe Naveh started. I was a solution engineer at the time and joined in by answering the campaign questions, then tagging others. That was my first real blog post and entry into the community. I wasn’t one of the founders or key players at the start - it was more of a resource to find answers or share thoughts. But that’s where it began for me.

FZ: What's your current role on the SAP Community team, and what does a typical day look like?

Josh: These days, I focus on promoting community advocacy. I help highlight what’s working and where we can improve. My work is all about connecting with people - online and in person - and making sure their voices are heard. There’s no “typical” day, but it involves a mix of content creation, listening to feedback, and strategizing how to make the community better.

FZ: You’ve done so much! What’s one part of the SAP community experience that you’re particularly proud of?

Josh: It’s hard to pick one, but I’ll mention three chapters in my SAP life. First, I was part of the team that transitioned SAP from BlackBerry to Apple devices, which was a major enterprise shift. We tackled security, analytics access, BYOD - it was a huge cross-functional effort. Then in pre-sales, I traveled extensively and gave technical demos to some of the biggest companies in the world. I got comfortable and confident in front of customers because I prepared so thoroughly - “sharpening the axe,” as they say. And in the Developer Advocate role, one big highlight was being trusted to go on stage for SAP TechEd, even during the COVID era when we broadcasted from Frankfurt. Being able to be myself and present on a global stage was unforgettable.

FZ: Amazing. Do you have a favorite or most memorable moment in the community?

Josh: One standout was my first SAP TechEd in Barcelona. Being in a role where I get to visit an amazing city like that is something else, but the real magic was seeing the show floor and the scale of how many SAP mentors and other legacy members made the trip. Some of my first SAP selfies with people I would work with for years were taken at that event.

FZ: How do you stay in tune with the community’s needs and feedback?

Josh: Three main ways. First, in-person events. That’s where people are really open. Online, they might not comment or engage as much, but in person they’ll say, “Hey, I saw your video!” Second, I post on YouTube and LinkedIn to keep communication flowing. Third, I look at outside platforms like Reddit or Stack Overflow to see what SAP techies are saying in the wild.

FZ: If you could wave a magic wand and change one thing in the community, what would it be?

Josh: I’d love to see more people offering constructive feedback - with solutions in mind. Not just “this is broken,” but “here’s how it could be better.” I know we can’t always implement every suggestion - due to technology limitations or staffing - but the community is stronger when members help shape it. The community is bigger than just a website. It’s every conversation, every event. And we need our members to be co-owners in it.

FZ: And one final question - do you have any advice for those new to SAP or the SAP Community, like me?

Josh: Absolutely. Be your own advocate. No one else is going to push you harder than you will. Learn how your managers listen. In meetings - listen first. Figure out how you can add value. People ask how they can have a role like mine. I say, there are two ways: either start a company and create your own path - or gain experience over time. I didn’t go to school for SAP. I started wiring buildings, setting up IT systems, and just kept learning. Over time, I built a brand and a reputation for being honest, responsive, and knowledgeable. Have a point of view - or put in the work. There’s no shortcut. Just engage with kindness and curiosity, and the rest will come.

FZ:  What a wonderful way to wrap things up! Thank you so much, Josh, for joining me today and sharing your SAP journey with us. It’s been a real pleasure having you here.

Josh: Thanks, Fatemeh. I really enjoyed our conversation.

entry.title: Re: Send Stock SAP MM to another application
entry.content:
Yes via message type MBGMCR, SAP can send IDocs automatically when a material document is posted, depending on your setup. You’ll need to configure output type in NACE for application MB. Assign a partner profile in WE20 and ensure the function module like IDOC_OUTPUT_WMMBXY is active. The advantage of having this set up is easy to monitor via WE02/WE05 and can be extended with user exits if needed. but on the other side, this requires IDoc infrastructure and mapping on the third-party side.

The other option is BAdI MB_DOCUMENT_BADI or EXIT_SAPMM07M_001 to intercept MIGO posting. From there, trigger a custom API call, a queue Or even write to a Z-table for later extraction. The advantage of going with this approach are full control over payload and timing and can be tailored to specific movement types. On the other side, it involves risk of performance impact if not handled asynchronously.

If your third-party system supports IDoc or can consume it via middleware like PI/CPI, go with Option 1 (IDoc MBGMCR or WMMBXY). It is clean, standard, and scalable. If you need real-time push with custom payload, go with Option 2 (BAdI) and trigger a REST API or queue.

entry.title: Re: How to batch print journal entries in Manage Journal...
entry.content:
Hello @jason_su 

Thanks for checking. Unfortunately, I cannot provide a live screenshot of your tenant. Sorry about that. But here IS what you should see in App F0744A – Manage Lease Contracts (Public Cloud)

The Upload option may not be visible by default. It appears only if your business role has the necessary permissions for uploading lease Contracts. In many customer systems, this permission is included in the SAP_BR_RENTAL_ACCOUNTANT role or a custom role derived from it.

If you only see Display and Create but not upload, ask your key user or administrator to verify the business catalogue SAP_REFX_CNTR_MGMT_PC and confirm if the Upload action is assigned.

Please note that the Upload function is only accessible in specific app views, such as the contract list screen. When you open an individual contract directly, the upload button will not be visible.

Feel free to reach out if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: 客户对S/4HANA Public Cloud的账套需求
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu ,

According to your requirement, it seems the parallel accounting requirement is as follow: one ledger for group accounting principle (Austria GAAP), one ledger for local ledger (Local GAAP) and one ledger group valuation(4G).

For parallel accounting, the recommendation is:
Leading ledger 0L  -> corporate accounting principle (IFRS/USGAAP or country/region-specific accounting principle)
Non-leading ledger 2L or 3L -> country/region-specific accounting principle(s).

The delivered system default is that the leading ledger is assigned to the local accounting principle, as a local ledger is always needed and you could have one ledger only. As soon as you have more than one ledger, SAP recommendation is to change this default. This means that you need to change the default assignments in configuration as shown above.

For your case:

0L -> Austria GAAP , maintain at corp AccPr level

2L-> Local GAAP, maintain at company code level

Please also note that you can only change the assignment of accounting principles to ledgers and company codes before the first posting in the system.

Reference: 

3530183 - Assigning Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Details on Configuration in General Ledger Accounting and Asset Accounting - SAP for Me

Question 16~22 in the In-Depth are suitable for your case:

In-Depth with SAP S/4HANA – Ledger Scoping Q&A - SAP Community

Kind Regards,

entry.title: Re: Connect SAP Workflow Sevice in the NEO environment to My Inbox on-premise
entry.content:
Hello,

although it has been a while since the last comment and the blog entry is quite old, I would like to make this response because I believe there are still many people out there looking for a solution to integrate cloud workflows into the on-premise Fiori inbox.

According to latest update of the SAP note 3071334 that refers to this blog entry, SAP still can not offer a standard integration approach.

However, since one of last updates to the SAP Build Process Automation Workflow API, we have been finally able to manage to successfully integrate our SAP Process Automation based approval tasks into the Fiori on-premise inbox on a project basis! To do this, we implemented a custom task provider for the on-premise Fiori Inbox, that queries the user's SBPA tasks and displays them in the Fiori Inbox. This allows us to use the on-premise Fiori Inbox as a true central task inbox again.

If you are also still looking for an integration option, please take a look at the current spec for the SAP Process Automation Workflow API in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Best regards
Markus

entry.title: Re: Outbound Transportation from MFG site having EWM,StRM, Lean Warehouse under one Freight Order to
entry.content:
Thanks for sharing, One point I found is that Load planning step in SAP TM where you can check HUs load plan and then then optimization happens which helps SAP EWM in loading the HUs in sequence of the TM Load plan.

If this batch managed stocks then there is added complexities here , please try to ensure we carry out the batch management process when dealing with MFG Sites as this MFG has always batch managed stocks which needs to be moved

entry.title: SAP Signavio Process Manager - Custom attributes visualization in the diagram
entry.content:
Dear Signavio Community, 

I am reaching out to you because I am facing a problem. 

What I want to do 🎯 : 

I would like to add have a custom attribute associated to my BPMN diagram tasks that will indicate if the task is a control or not. And I would like this custom attribute to be added the layer visualization of my diagrams so that my users can see exactly at which step of their process they have controls to perform.  Here is an illustration of what it could look like : 1 logo to illustrate it is a control and the reference (could also be the name) of the control. 

 

 

 

What I did  😎: 

So far, I have

1. Create associated categories in the Dictionary :

A. One for the Risks

 

B. One for the Controls 

2. Associate the control to the Tasks of my modeling language:

 

Where I am stuck 😥 : 

When I go to the Attribute visualization set-up and I start to create an attribute visualization I cannot choose the good property value:

 

 

Which is strange because we have created other custom attributes that I see in the property value list: 

 

 

Thank you in advance for your help on this one ! 🙏

entry.title: Re: Integrating SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Build Process Automation via SAP Cloud Application Event
entry.content:
Hi @MMonis , 

In order to discover the events available from the LoB system in SAP Build, you need to perform all the steps listed in Step 5: Create Integration Formation. 

Could you confirm that you created this formation and it's synchronized successfully? 

Best Regards,

Emanuil

entry.title: on S/4HANA, if I use ADT to create custom CDS views, is it keeping the core clean?
entry.content:
Using ADT, if I were to create custom CDS views in S/4HANA on PCE or in S/4HANA on premise so I can create custom data products in SAP BDC, am I still keeping the core clean?   

Thanks.

Regards,

Mel Calucin

entry.title: Re: ByDesign Extension Scenario modify
entry.content:
Hi,

The extension scenario in patch solution that has been assembled in a previous version of the Solution. You are not allowed to do the changes because existing data will become inconsistent if you modify an existing extension scenario.

You can create an additional Process Extension Scenario and add it to the element annotation.

Please review below help document.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CLOUD_APPLICATIONS_STUDIO/cbcebe3cfb1647a8b0322c18dbb0b481/73548c1a73e21014a9d5d0378a32b555.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=CLOUD

Regards,

Vivek
